Description: Complete child's hood made of several layers of undyed linen plain weave; a rectangular piece of fabric has been folded in half then sewn along the top to create the hood; all outer edges (along the top and back, either side of the face and around the neck edges) had decorative additions of bands of undyed and red linen (c.1.5cm wide; sewn down with oversewing); along the top seam are twisted/knotted red threads; on the left side of the hood are two holes in the fabric filled with additonal red/undyed linen fabric; on the inner side of the right of the hood is a group of addtional red threads; the ret of the hood may have been covered with over fabric but nothing remains; the external layer of plain weave is damaged with holes; edges of the plain weave have been hemmed under the decorative bands; the hood may have been sewn to a tunic afterwards as it is not cut from a larger piece; plain weave (left side, external layer): warp-undyed linen (S/44), weft-undyed linen (S/16); plain weave (right side, inner layer): warp-undyed linen (S/40), weft-undyed linen (S/16); decorative band: warp-undyed linen (S/some paired/12), weft-undyed and red linen (S/some paired/alternating lines of extended plain weave (undyed and red) and tapestry (red only)); sewing: undyed linen (S spun Z ply)
